result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Jason Freeman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Jason Freeman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Christopher Jason Freeman.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Jason Freeman in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant Christopher Jason Freeman in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Castro. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Jason Freeman not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Garvin-Guimont to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  No Contact Order/No Firearms Order.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with I.S.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for level 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Christopher Jason Freeman in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Jason Freeman in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an initial appearance.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court set the matter over for a preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court scheduled an initial appearance date on June 22, 2022 at 1:30 PM.  Parties notified of next court date.
